basics.name: Gaël Van der Lee
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: Programmer, Brain Researcher, tech-enthusiast, aspiring climber

work.name: University of Lille
work.summary: The European GENESIS project aims to find neural signals associated with the user experience in VR.
highlights: Research focuses on neural signals associated with cybersickness and vection at the intersection of BCIs and VR.
Designed, obtained ethics approval for, and ran a full user study (software in Unity & Python, EEG acquisition, VR synchronisation via LSL) from proposal to publication.
Performed comprehensive literature reviews on BCI and cybersickness; wrote and published multiple peer-reviewed papers.
Handled participant recruitment, experimental hardware (OpenBCI, ANTNeuro, GTec) and software development in Unity/OpenVibe.
Presented research at international conferences; created posters and defended results to multidisciplinary audiences.
Taught master-level classes at Centrale Lille (Machine Learning and Signal Processing in English).

work.name: Amazon
work.summary: The Amazon ATS team is responsible for the transportation of packages from the fulfillment center to the customer's doorstep.
highlights: Created a machine-learning pipeline using boosted trees (XGBoost/LightGBM) to predict package-loss root cause.
Extensively used AWS (S3, SageMaker, Lambda, Step Functions, EC2) and Data Lake for scalable training and inference.
Applied test-driven development, version control and thorough documentation to ensure long-term maintainability and smooth hand-off to the owning team.

work.name: Amazon
work.summary: The Amazon ATS team is responsible for the transportation of packages from the fulfillment center to the customer's doorstep.
highlights: Designed an end-to-end anomaly detector and corrector for outbound-volume time-series data at global scale, delivering an estimated $7 MM annual benefit in NA alone.
Implemented hybrid anomaly-detection strategies using ARIMA, Exponential Smoothing, Prophet, LSTMs and Transformer models on both synthetic and real data.
Presented results and advised on the Y3R scientific roadmap for anomaly-detection approaches.

work.name: Lofty AI
work.summary: Lofty AI is a startup that aims to use a wide range of publicly available data in order to predict the evolution of the real-estate market.
highlights: Created scalable end-to-end data and ML pipelines handling social-media, satellite imagery, demographics and time-series data under tight startup timelines.
Developed hybrid deep-learning models (LSTMs & CNNs) and internal Python tooling that accelerated team experimentation.
Mentored new hires in Python best practices & Git, and communicated technical progress to investors during the Y-Combinator program.

work.name: Vericrypt
work.summary: Vericrypt helps users make informed decisions by aggregating and analyzing millions of news articles, autonomously giving them bias and trustworthiness ratings.
highlights: Developed, deployed and maintained an NLP pipeline (summarisation, sentiment & bias analysis) processing hundreds of articles daily on AWS.
Introduced a novel emotional-manipulation-detection technique by benchmarking against an objective baseline from scientific articles.
Secured acceptance into UCSD’s “The Basement” incubator and pitched technical vision to angel investors.

work.name: Neurala
work.summary: Neurala develops lightweight models for use on portable devices.
highlights: Built a plug-and-play vision toolkit (published as a pip package) enabling Neurala’s proprietary few-shot classifier to interface with multiple CNN/segmentation backbones.
Achieved 0.396 AP / 0.371 AR on COCO while working with very-large image datasets; included custom annotation, training and benchmarking pipelines.

work.name: University of California, San Diego – de Sa Lab
work.position: Research Assistant – Algorithm Development for Brain-Computer Interfaces
work.summary: Worked in Prof. de Sa’s lab on advanced signal processing for EEG-based BCIs.
highlights: Developed a novel deep-learning architecture for CSP-like time-series feature extraction, improving accuracy by 2–4 % on benchmark datasets.
Designed experimental protocols and validated models on real EEG BCI datasets.
Collaborated in an academic research environment and contributed to internal presentations and publications.

volunteer.summary: Helped teach young girls how to code with the aim of helping them solve a problem in their community.
Volunteered to help develop an app to teach immigrants in the US to speak French.
Assisted the head of the UCSD Data Science department in teaching undergraduate data-science courses.
highlights: Helped design and grade programming assignments and data-visualisation projects.
Provided coding assistance and conceptual explanations during labs and office hours.
